critique: The document is an executive order issued by President Trump regarding Sudan. It amends a previous executive order (13761) by changing dates and revoking a section. The order invokes the International Emergency Economic Powers Act and other laws, suggesting it deals with foreign policy and potentially sanctions. There is nothing to suggest a shift in social inclusion. The order itself does not obviously expand executive power, but it does continue a policy set by previous executive orders. The order does not obviously relate to immigration. The order does not obviously relate to economic regulation. The order does not obviously relate to federalism. The order seems to be related to national security, but it is difficult to assess the impact on civil liberties without more context.
